title: Nigeria: Neglect of Nigerian Satellites Partly Responsible for Recession of Lake Chad
text:
Nigeria: NCC Shuts Firm Over Illegal Operation in Kano By Dele Ogbodo Abuja — The neglect of Nigerian satellite imageries developed by the National Space Research Development Agency (NASRDA), by ministries and agencies of government has been given partly as reason for the recession faced by Lake Chad. THISDAY learnt that apathy and inter-agency rivalries between the authority and ministries responsible for the development of the basin with the right satellite data has led to the deplorable state of the basin. This was stated by the former Chairman, Senate Committee on Science and Technology, Prof. Ajayi Boroffice, the Director General of the National Space Research Development Agency (NASRDA), Prof. Seidu Onailo Mohammed, the Director Centre for Space Technology Development (CSTD), Dr. Spencer Onu, and the Director, Strategic Space Applications, Dr. Halidu Shaba. They averred that the ministries and agencies of government do not patronize research and programmes developed by NASRDA for the country's development. Nigeria
